item.title: Serilog Do's and Don'ts
item.description: Serilog is a structured logger for .NET, and as such, for folks who are used to traditional console loggers, requires the developer to think about their logs a little more than normal. This post is not meant to be a how to, but rather a non-comprehensive list of mistakes I’ve seen over time. Templating One thing to keep in mind is that when writing an event to the log, you are not passing a message, but a template.
